==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|かみ|に|だん|かつ|よう|yomi=y}}

===Etymology===
A compound of {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|上二段|tr=kami nidan||upper dual grade}} and {{m|ja|sc=Jpan|活用|tr=katsuyō||conjugation}}. Eventually changes into [[上一段活用]] (kami ichidan katsuyō) verbs. The "upper" notation refers to the base -i which comes before the "lower" -e in Japanese order.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|かみ にだん かつよう|acc=6|acc_ref=DJR|y=y}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かみ にだん かつよう|hhira=かみにだんくわつよう}}

# {{lb|ja|grammar|sort=かみにだんかつよう}} upper dual grade conjugation; a verbal conjugation class which has the following inflections: i/i/u/uru/ure/i[yo]. Dual refers to the two columns (i and u) of the syllabary table that the conjugation occurs in. Dual grade conjugation occurs in literary Japanese, while the same verbs conjugate as Kami-Ichidan (e.g. 落つ-> 落ちる) in colloquial Japanese.
